intro: Wisteria sinensis var. violacea-plena, commonly known as the Japanese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to China. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant clusters of violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces long, pendulous racemes of blossoms, which can reach up to 30 cm in length. Its leaves are compound, consisting of 10–20 oval-shaped leaflets. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
